paint.fiji.trackmate

Class RunTrackMateOnProject

  • java.lang.Object
    • paint.fiji.trackmate.TrackMateHeadless
      • paint.fiji.trackmate.RunTrackMateOnRecording
        • paint.fiji.trackmate.RunTrackMateOnExperiment
          • paint.fiji.trackmate.RunTrackMateOnProject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, org.scijava.command.Command, org.scijava.plugin.SciJavaPlugin

    public class RunTrackMateOnProject
extends RunTrackMateOnExperiment
    The RunTrackMateOnProject class orchestrates the TrackMate analysis across multiple experiments contained within a project directory.

    It validates image directories and configuration files before processing, handles per-experiment execution, supports user-initiated cancellation, and logs all key events and outcomes.

    Each experiment is validated and processed independently, ensuring that a failure in one experiment does not halt others. At completion, a total runtime summary is logged.

    • Method Detail

      • runProject

        public static boolean runProject(Path projectPath,
                                 Path imagesPath,
                                 List<String> experimentNames,
                                 ProjectDialog dialog,
                                 Path sweepDir)
        Executes the TrackMate analysis pipeline for all specified experiments within the given project directory. Performs validation on both image roots and CSV metadata, then runs the core processing for each experiment.
        Parameters:
        projectPath - the root directory of the Paint project containing experiment subfolders
        imagesPath - the directory containing image files for the experiments
        experimentNames - list of experiment folder names to be processed
        dialog - optional ProjectDialog used for user-driven cancellation
        sweepDir - optional override directory for writing analysis results (defaults to projectPath if null)
        Returns:
        true if all experiments processed successfully; false if any validation or runtime errors occurred
